Package DB.Tickets

Class IOTickets

java.lang.Object
DB.Tickets.IOTickets
public class IOTickets extends Object
This class manage the tickets database. Within it there are function used for visualizing, checking, adding and deleting tickets.
Version:
1.0.4
Author:
Danilo Basini

    IOTickets()
    Constructor: it contains information about the databases and it's used to create a new object of its type.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addTicket​(String idFlight, String userMail, int ticketsToBuy)
    Function: it's used to add a new ticket to the database, checking that the new one wasn't in it already and managing all the exception that could be created.
    void
    deleteTicket​(String ticketToDelate)
    Function: it's used to delete a ticket from the database, checking its existence in the file.
    String[][]
    getAllTickets()
    Function: it's used to reading from the database every ticket contained in it.
    String[]
    getBoughtTickets​(String mail)
    Function: it's used to read from the database the number of bought ticket of a specific user.
    String
    getFlightToPrint​(String id)
    Function: it's used to read from the database some specific flight and print it on screen.
    void
    printAllTickets()
    Function: it's used to visualize and print on screen every ticket within the database.
    void

    Function: it's used to print on screen the number of bought tickets for a specific user.
    String
    printTicket​(String ticket)
    Function: it's used to print on screen every ticket of the various flights that a user has bought.
    boolean
    verifyExisting​(String[] ticket, int nTicket)
    Function: it's used to check the existence of a ticket within the database, using the information of the ticket itself.

    Function: it's used to check the existence of a ticket within the database, using ID, user's mail and number of bought ticket.
